Description: Fragment of flattened handle from a Thasian pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine, highly micaceous, brick red. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Greek inscription and letter delta, with apices, as symbol.
Curator's comments: Name Polyneikes. cf. Ch. Tchokev, The Athenian Agora xxxvii, 148, no, 227, and Bon, A. and A., Les timbres amphoriques de Thasos (Paris 1957) 1361-2, but with apices - see Bon and Bon p. 340. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 173, 5.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0026)
